subject: Re: [Call for QS ... voting in January] - Peter's revised proposal
msgSnippet: ... document qs_keybd_proposals.csv ... your ... (especially ... you ... Whoops. Yes you are correct.  I ve made a mistake in the mapping. It should be: bay
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Ted Larson Freeman"
<freeman@...> wrote:
>
> Thanks, Peter. I've just updated the
document 'qs_keybd_proposals.csv'
> to include these changes. I think there a couple of typos in your
> list, so I just want to double-check to make sure that I've got
your
> proposal correct. In the list below, I see these mappings:
>
> bay <-> y
>
> Excite <-> x
>
> Exam <-> X
>
> I'm confident that you meant "bay <-> b" in the first case
(especially
> since you also have "ye <-> y"). For the last two, I initially just
> used x and X as you have them here. But then in your discussion,
you
> say this:
>
> - Excite <-> X :
> Reason: same as half of other proposals. Chose upper case to stay
> consistent with the common theme of upper case letters saying their
> own name. Chose this even though 'excite' is more frequent in use
> than 'exam'. In this case both letters are so infrequent that the
> possible shift key stroke saving would hardly amount to anything.
>
> - Exam <-> x :
> Reason: same as half of other proposals, see 'excite' above.
>
> So now I've switched them to "Excite <-> X" and "Exam <-> x".
>
> Please let me know if I've got it right.
>
> Thanks.
>
> Ted
>
>


Whoops. Yes you are correct. I've made a mistake in the mapping.
It should be:
bay <-> b
Excite <-> X
Exam <-> x.
Thanks for correcting this.

Peter
